problems.title: Hello World
problems.description: Write a program that prints exactly 'Hello, World!' to the console.

problems.title: Sum of Two
problems.description: Take two space-separated integers and print their sum.
problems.explanation: To solve this, use `scanf` with two `%d` format specifiers to read the integers into variables. Then, use `printf` with `%d` to display their sum computed as `a + b`.

starter_codes.python:
a, b = map(int, input().split())
print(a + b)

problems.title: Product of Three
problems.description: Read three integers and print their product.
problems.explanation: Calculate the result of a * b * c after reading three inputs.

starter_codes.python:
a, b, c = map(int, input().split())
print(a * b * c)

problems.title: Float Division
problems.description: Read two integers a and b, and output a divided by b with exactly 2 decimal places.
problems.explanation: In C, you must cast at least one integer to `float` before division: `(float)a / b`. Use `%.2f` in `printf`. In Python, `a / b` performs float division by default; use `f"{res:.2f}"` or `round`.

problems.title: ASCII Value
problems.description: Read a single character and print its ASCII integer value.
problems.explanation: In C, using `%d` with a `char` variable prints its ASCII code. In Python, use the `ord()` function.
